newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Arab shipbuilding reports higher profit in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Arab shipbuilding reports higher profit in 1996.

text.p: The Arab Shipbuilding and Repair Yard (ASRY) said on Wednesday its 1996 net profit more than doubled to $3.43 million from $1.47 million last year.
A company statement said gross sales rose to a record $89.5 million in 1996, up 21 percent from 1995. Operating profit before depreciation rose to $10.79 million from $8.76 million.
The company's board of directors had decided to distribute four percent of the 1996 net profit "as an incentive bonus to all employees," it added.
ASRY is owned by the governments of Saudi Arabia, Iraq, Qatar, Bahrain, Kuwait, the United Arab Emirates and Libya.
